entries.meaning: (uncountable, colloquial, Australia, New Zealand) Registration for a motor vehicle.
examples: The police pulled me over for driving with an expired rego.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, colloquial, Australia, New Zealand) The fee required for such registration.
examples: David couldn′t drive his car as he hadn′t paid his rego.

entries.meaning: (countable, colloquial, Australia, New Zealand) The registration number of a motor vehicle, used by police to access registration details such as the identity of the owner.
examples: “They also got the regos of the cars. There were two commercial travelers whose cars were trapped inside by the pickets, and they got hit with writs. […] ”
